thread.title: Former middle school students look for missing time capsule
thread.title_full: Former middle school students look for missing time capsule - US News

author: USNews
title: Former middle school students look for missing time capsule
text:
Former Florida middle school students looking for missing time capsule buried in 1970s Associated Press Oct. 5, 2015 | 9:10 a.m. EDT + More INDIALANTIC, Fla. (AP) â€” Former students of a central Florida middle school were hoping to crack open a buried time capsule to celebrate the 50th anniversary of Hoover Middle School.
The problem is no one remembers where it was buried.
Florida Today (http://on.flatoday.com/1MTWCP2 ) reports teacher Jack Deppner filmed students on an 8 millimeter camera in 1976. He also collected mementos to bury in the time capsule.
Students reconnected on Facebook and raised the idea of opening the capsule. But no one knew where it was buried. Deppner died a few years ago, but had searched for years and never found the spot.
Former student Dawn Atkinson-Spaccio says they're planning on using metal detectors and ground penetrating radar to scour the campus. If they pinpoint a location, they'll seek permission from the school to start digging.
___
Information from: Florida Today (Melbourne, Fla.), http://www.floridatoday.com
